A Trio bin has been placed on the desire line of the path . The wide side of the bin has been placed across the desire line reducing the options for path users to avoid each other. Worse the person on a bicycle on avoiding the pedestrian and the obstructions may be compromised by a motor vehicle approaching from behind (the person on the bike distracted by walker and all the obstructions ahead) . The bin needs turning through 90 degrees however....
Ideally relocate this bin against the fence where the old bin used to be now it has been removed. 
https://trafford.cyclestreets.net/location/97744/

Traffic comes around corner from Dunham too fast on a blind corner.

 Make stretch through / edge of town centre between High Street and Woodlands Road 20 mph,

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This road is so badly overgrown that it's now down to about 1 metre wide in places.  It just needs scraping back - the trees and bushes are all gone, it's just the soil that remains.  It's half a day's work to scrape back and brush clean and you have a much, much wider and safer route.  It's already popular with walkers and cyclists - cleaning it would make it moreso.

Also, please fix the streetlights - it isn't an issue at this time of year but in the winter this is a dark, lonely place.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: A protected cycle lane has recently has recently been installed on Stretford Road in Trafford . At the boundary the suddenly stops . Provide temporary cycle lane from the boundary all the way to the University with a view to putting in permanent infrastructure .

This area is used for parking at night, right around the cenotaph. Please barrier off properly to protect space for pedestrians. A lot of cracked flags here due parking.
Thanks

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The only access from Dane Road onto the Bridgewater Way towpath is via Danefield road. There is no footpath and a desire line has been created across the verge. There used to be steps at the pin location, but these have since been closed/forgotten about. The steps should be reinstated and/or a new ramp built.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The dual lane of washway road should be single lane on either side with cycle paths / extended pavements using up the space created. This will eventually lead to reduced traffic along this exceptionally busy corridor (as drivers find alternative routes). In addition hgvs should be required to use carrington spur to reduce pollution/noise/vibrations in a dense residential area.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Existing basic cycle infrastructure here is faded and worn. Often ignored by queuing traffic during rush hour, who pull to the left to allow cars to illegally filter on the right rather than wait. This causes very limited space for cycles and 'left hooks' from motorists. There's also lots of mobile phone use while waiting in queues, often while pulling left! 
There is no way to avoid this intersection and join the Canal at Brooklands when coming from the top end of Firs Road.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: We need a safe alternative to make short distance journeys. There are large queues of traffic in both directions throughout the day. Mostly one person per car.  We need to design that reduces volume of traffic so that people who need to drive can do so more easily. Do this by making it safer for those who don’t t need to drive to take a safe and healthy option.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Traffic speeds towards double roundabout, which is also intimidating for new/inexperienced cyclists. Cars often park alongside bikes waiting at the roundabout, placing them at risk.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars have always driven far too fast down this road. It has access to the park and is also well used by school children attending both Wellfield primary school and Park Road primary school. The road is used as a cut through to take traffic off A56. I fear this will get busy when the  A 56 is narrowed to accommodate cycle lanes, which I do agree with. As the road is straight it encourages cars to drive far too fast.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
It can be impossible to walk on the pavements on this side road as cars park on them.  There is never enough room to push a pram through.
Please stop cars from parking on the pavements.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are painted cycle lanes on both sides of this road. The paint has faded so the lanes are no longer visible. The cycle lanes are not safe as cars are parked over them constantly. It should be an offence to park over cycle lanes. It would be a good idea to make these lanes more permanent as this road leads directly to the Trafford centre and is used for hospital workers also.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The cycle infrastruacture here is shared space with pedestrians involving many crossings going round the roundabout in a clockwise fashion whereas the quickest route to Village Way from Parkway is to cross here - this includes reaching the tram strop.  At least add in signage and markings  to guide people via this quick route instead of the many minutes it takes to navigate clockwise

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Marlborough/Montague Road is primarily a narrow residential crescent, made dangerous by speeding traffic rat-running to avoid the l/h only turn at the top of Hope Road or to avoid the lights at the top of Wardle Road. In normal times, cars can be regularly found parked on yellow lines, or on the pavements, especially at school pick up and drop off, making for an unsafe and hazardous environment. The school playground is also used as a church "car park",  with cars exiting for speed to Marlborough via the playground gates instead of through the main car park entrance. Current road restrictions are rarely policed.

fields.value: Brooks Drive is a nice path to use (although it needs cleaning up because it's overgrown and too narrow to socially distance), but getting across this roundabout is damn near impossible.  Drivers don't see people waiting here as valid road users - sometimes I've pulled onto the roundabout and the drivers waiting on Shaftesbury Avenue from the west just pull straight out in front of me. I hate this roundabout, traffic speeds are absolutely insane.

value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Far too much space for parking cars, gets really busy and dangerous for shoppers, this street could easily be closed to cars as there is access at either end of the High street

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Far too much traffic and no cycle lanes, speeding cars do very close drive bys

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Very narrow pavement/shared use cycle path

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a direct route to Trafford Park yet it is only about 2 feet wide, basically just the space behind the crash barrier. Take out the first lane on Parkway and reallocate to cyclists and remove the barrier to provide more space for pedestrians .

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Shared use cycling and walking route

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a route to Bridgewater Way, access to the Bridgewater canal - to Stretford, Sale and Barton aqueduct but as with many locations the shrubbery has been allowed to encroach until only about 2 feet is left with brambles slashing anybody who cycles down.  Please clear the overgrowth - would be happy to help if machinery and skips provided (and thick gloves)

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Changing Hillingdon Road - Stretford, into a quiet space for residents.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Rat run and through road to beat the Traffic Lights on Kings Road/Edge Lane

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
We have quickly surveyed some (not all) residents along the road and those that have commented are overwhelmingly in favour for our road to be safer and quieter place for families to sit, play chat and dwell  in pleasanter surroundings.

We would like to test two options:
Option 1 - Temporary filter Hillingdon Road at the Edge Lane junction - i.e. closed to vehicular access.

Option 2 - Make Hillingdon Road one way from Edge lane to Faulkner Road.

We would also wish to create some chicanes by adding parklets and benches to alter the layout of the road from a straight road to a curvy one and a place where people can sit and talk whilst kids play.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Very dangerous corner. Crazy parking. Wide fast road. Busy shops, school route and mosque. Very hard to cross safely.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This side road is well used by pupils going to Urmston Juniors, English Martyrs, the nurseries and Urmston grammar. It is a link from Eden Square to the alleyway that runs behind Roseneath rd to all of these. Excessive parking, including on the pavement makes this unsafe. Remove parking, make it access only for residents to access the rear of their properties and this will create a safe route for children to walk, scoot or cycle to school.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Due to volumes of traffic and parking on Moorside Road, this is a difficult location to cross or to exit on a bicyle.  It is a direct route to and from Eden Square and even though there is a zebra at the junction with Roseneath Road, hardly any cars stop there and that is out of the way for anybody coming out of Denstone Road - a route to Old Crofts bank etc.  For older people  even a short detour is tiring.  Maybe build out the pavement here to give better visibility or even better remove on street parking

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Now is the time to remove the horrible anti-pedestrian barriers all along Edge Lane from Chester Road to Kings Road.

Reduce this section of road to one lane both ways
Place planters and some greenery along the centre

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Live near here. Cycle and walk with children here.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Live near here. Cycle and walk with children here.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Like the opposite side, this location is a barrier to cycling for anybody wanting to reach Stretford and Urmston from the safe cycling route on Talbot road.  In a mirror image of the route on the otherside, cyclists wishing to reach Davyhulme Road east have to navigate to lane 3 of a 4 lane A road,  Drivers who believe you should be on the white lines instead of safely in the middle of the lane deliberately cut up or close pass any cyclist brave enough to use it.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This spot is bad for pavement parking  out Go Local and the Chicken Takeaway

Some cones would help.

PS those nasty grey anti pedestrian barriers opposite also need to be removed. This pens people in together, so we are not to socially distance.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Dangerous merging of two lanes into one

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The immediate merging of two lanes into one serves no purpose apart from drivers racing each other without awareness or consideration for cyclists and the angle of the turn causes them to come very close.  I would suggest making the 3rd lane of the A56 a cycle lane and creating a cycle lane on Davyhulme Road East

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Please remove the parking bays and prevent access to cars constantly parked on the pavement in front of the shops on the Quadrant and just around the corner on Kings Road. 

Some are delivery drivers, some cars visiting the takeaways, some of which belong to the retail/shop/chemist owners.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Prevent anti social pavement parking with a parklet which provides waiting  for the bike shop and somewhere to lock bikes while in the shops

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Remove the anti cycling barriers at this location

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Provide a temp ramp over anti cycling kerb

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: remove 2x kerbs  or provide temp ramp over this kerbside barrier on a well used cycle route

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Please provide temp cycle lanes along Seymour Grove from Upper Chorlton Road to Talbot Road - Both sides 
Regards

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Time to introduce 20mph where bike icons are painted in the road.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: provision of lighting along this stretch of the park would link up the park and create a safer cycling and walking environment

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Unsafe crossing point at  Shaftesbury Ave & Aimson Rd West

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Crossing point has no safe time for cyclists to go across Shaftesbury Ave from the park as the traffic from Aimson road turning right onto Shaftes.Ave have green light whilst the pedestrian Crossing Is green.  Need separate crossing Point at the left of junction to distance safely from pedestrians and enable Cyclists to continue along Aimson Rd .

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars use the road leading to the roundabout to start accelerating already for the motorway making the pedestrian crossing difficult on quickest route to the water park by foot and bike. Earlier cycle lane disappears into shared use path to cross the entry ramp but should extend all the way over the two roundabouts as will get cars closepassing and not slowing to turn onto entry ramp

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Speeds coming off motorway with many cars not slowing that can make it difficult for pedestrians to cross. Also cars not looking for cycles going straight into water park

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: remove kerb or add temp ramp to allow access for cycles

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: install temp bi-directional cycle way from MUFC to Old Trafford Metrolink Station

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: well used cycle commute and leisure route

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Please add a temp bi-directional cycle path along the northern side of  the whole of Warwick Road. This will also remove the on-street paid parking. but leaves the resident parking in place

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: open the barrier and replace with one or two traffic cones

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: please reduce Kingsway to one lane both sides and provide temp cycle lanes

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Provide protection and extend the current painted cycle lane into a bi-directional one from Chester Road/Bridgewater way along to Talbot Road/Stretford Rod Junction - removing the on-street parking will provide for safe extended footpaths.

Plus this bi-directional could be extended along Chester Road to link with the bi-directional protected lance which ends/starts at Lower Moss Lane.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This road as a painted cycle way -  not that you would notice!

Please remove the parking on the school side all along this stretch and provide a protected cycle and extended footway.

Need this asap and definitely before school reopens

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: remove anti cycling barrier and pinch point for walkers

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Reduce exit from exit from M60 to one lane

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Death trap roundabout when approaching from Rifle Road as  m60 route anti clockwise cars speed, don’t indicate and ignore cyclists. Also vehicles leaving M60 for A6144 use BOTH lanes to turn right to gain a car length advantage by “undertaking” on the inside lane at speed. Very dangerous.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Travelling straight on A6144 into Sale, cars turning left onto Worthington Road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: When travelling straight into Sale Moor on bicycle, cars turning left onto Worthington Riad often speed and cut up cyclist to access Worthington Road  as they turn left. Additionally cars turning right out of Worthington Road frequently encroach into the space required by cyclists to proceed, thus resulting in cyclist having to move into road not knowing what traffic is coming behind them.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: When cycling from Marsland Road and into Sale Moor, one has to position oneself dangerously as cars follow from behind and travel from Northern Moor (usually at speed) and then either move left to access Northenden Road or right to access Sale Moor. It is difficult and dangerous for cyclists to safely negotiate the splits in the traffic if travelling through Sale Moor.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Traffic leaving Sale Moor rapidly speeds up as approaching M60 and to try and “catch the lights” at Dane Road. Abused by cars, motorcycles and hgv’s. Ad hoc/occasional or permanent speed cameras would helps. At rush hours when traffic slows, the number of mobile telephone users driving is appalling and extremely dangerous.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Rifle Road access to Metrolink station.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: For pedestrians and cyclists travelling from Sale Moor, they will have  negotiated two poor/dangerous crossings as vehicles access the m60 clockwise and leave the M60 anti clockwise. It is not uncommon for vehicles to speed/accelerate into Rifle Road just at the point that cyclists may have remounted and pedestrians are crossing Rifle Road to access the Metrolink station.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Barrier stops double buggies or bucket bikes getting access from Stretford to Sale Water park

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are a number of steel barriers for cycle paths that make it hard for double buggies/bucket bikes to pass freely.  Would strongly encourage a review of these.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Improve this whole stretch of the A56 northbound to improve path for pedestrians and cyclists.  MANY curbs are not dropped, path disappears at the recycling centre cutting off cycle routes safely from the rest of Stretford.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There is little time to safely cross the road. Cars often ignore the red light delay people crossing. The lights need to go red quicker and stay on red for a further 10 seconds to enable people to cross safely. The pavement outside the shops is very narrow too.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Cars travel well over posted 30 mph limit. Which considering Henrietta Street passes a large park and is in a residential neighborhood seems like an excessive speed limit. Propose 20 mph limit and traffic calming measures. 

Since cars park either side and it is not possible for 2 cars to pass each other possible solution would be narrowing road in places and adding planters

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Kings road from at least Seymour Grove to Upper Chorlton road does not have ONE single pedestrian crossing. I walk daily (pre and during covid) and cross this road with a pram or on bicycle and it is extremely dangerous. Parked cars make it difficult to see oncoming traffic and the lack of crossing points makes it dangerous for anyone attempting to cross the road.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are two lanes for cars Westbound here, until one filters towards Sale. This is unnecessary. One lane could be closed and used for cycling and an extended pavement.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are two anti-cycling barriers on the bridge over the brook. It's a pinchpoint for walkers and cyclists, which makes social distancing difficult. The barriers should be removed.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Remove the 'No Cycling' signs on all access points to this section of Baguley Lane.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
These barriers (were they erected with planning permission?) force people walking and riding to use a narrow gap at the side.  This makes social distancing a problem.  And if you're elderly or infirm and struggle to lift your bicycle across the barrier, it might prevent you making your journey full stop.

I understand anti-social behaviour by people driving on the fields is why these barriers exist, but they should not exclude legitimate, legal users of Carrington Moss.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Ashfield Road is a narrow, single lane two-way connection that is a busy rat run between Manor Road & Hale Road. Its narrow pavements don’t allow pedestrians to pass at safe distance. Stopping through traffic would reduce traffic flow, allowing walkers to use the road to keep safe distancing and encouraging safe cycling.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Dark Lane is a hugely overgrown road and a public right of way, but it's almost unusable now.  If it were cleared it would be a much nicer way of getting from Whitehouse Lane to Birch Road, free of traffic.  Sinderland Lane is pretty much impossible to walk along.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: A gate has been built at the end of this public right of way, removing access to Carrington Moss for everyone.  This has been done to keep motorcycles off the moss, but why should everyone suffer for the actions of a minority?  It needs to be removed.  It's the police who should deal with antisocial behaviour - law-abiding folk need not be punished.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The crossing has a dog leg island in the middle controlled by two separate beg buttons. It makes it very hard and slow to cross from the west of the A56 to the east (to access the canal bridle way which is the only safe route to Sale centre). It’s impossible to maintain 2m distance on the island as well.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This corner is incredibly dangerous. There have been a number of accidents due to cars speeding around the corner and losing control. It is also a major crossing point for children for the park and 2 primary schools and a cycle route for older children to aom school.. there should be a 20 mile an hour limit along the whole of glebelands Road, traffic calming measures on this corner.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars use Barkers Lane as a cut through and regularly speed. The road is the access to a primary school and a nursery so there are lots of kids around making this dangerous. The footpaths are narrow and you have to walk in the road to keep 2m apart, which is dangerous given the speeding traffic. Speed limit should be reduced to 20mph.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: its the condition of the road surface on Oxford Rd that's the real issue that needs to be fixed. Pot holes are the biggest and deepest I've seen in the area so makes cycling dangerous as well as cars swaying to avoid them. Its a very well used tgmhrough road that needs urgent tlc.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: strip of land between Barton Rd and Iona Way

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This strip of green land, under which I presume is the Thirlmere Aqueduct, is a perfect place for people to exercise and a good shortcut for cycling - but it's blocked off at either end.

There's no reason why people can't walk here, or cycle (given a decent surface), so why not remove the gates and allow people to use it?

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Please send a team down to remove the overgrowth and extend the pavement - it's impossible to stay distant from other users here.  And there's tonnes of space to make this path wider.  It'd also be great if you could add more access points, as that might make vulnerable users feel safer.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The A56 is dangerous to cycle on and difficult to cross. It’s the main obstacle to people being able to use their bikes for short trips. Yet there are acres of tarmac. There’s plenty of space to add segregated cycle lanes without removing lanes for cars. Narrower lanes might even make drivers obey the speed limit too.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Barrington Road is primarily a residential road and used by children en route to school but there is no safe crossing . 
Residents of the retirement flats find it difficult to cross over to the bus stops.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: It’s time that the whole market area is closed to traffic (except for deliveries at certain times )

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: We’ve lost a couple of trees in this area already due to cars reversing into them.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Publicly maintained hedges on Moss Vale Road Urmston are so overgrown that they take up all the pavement. Which makes pedestrians walk in the road and the cyclists and motorists have to swerve to avoid. Dangerous

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Love this idea. Well done Trafford. I will definitely use my bike if cycle lane is installed on wash way road.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are lots of cars that park literally on and across the pavement. Pedestrians can be forced to walk in the road. Add 2m distancing and it becomes awkward.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There is also a private school on this road before a blind bend and the speed at which cars drive down is terrible. It's only a matter of time before someone gets hurt.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Many children live on this road and it would be lovely if cars didnt use it as a cut through. The children have been able to cycle safely up and down the street during this eased lockdown.

Some people have 6 cars on their driveway and road its unnecessary. Let keep the air pollution free for our children and grandchildren.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Need to look across a wide area before crossing

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: I've always disliked crossing the road here with the kids. You have to look all the way around, almost 360 degrees, before deciding to cross.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Too many people parking on pavements.
Households with far too may cars parked on the street.

Speed at which people drive down the road is scary especially when alot of young children live here.

I would like this street to have speed bumps or better still close one end off.
Parking restrictions would also be welcome.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The trees in the middle of the footpath make it hard to walk here. I'm not suggesting we get rid of the trees but rather improve the pavement area.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: You have to watch all the lights and time your crossing. A green man would be good. A busy crossing place at school time.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The area between Costa, M&S, Bean and Brush, Bianco's & Tesco is just awful to walk around. It's a valid part of the town centre and has high footfall. Cars are coming from all directions and often pause to drop or collect passengers. Better crossings and wider footpaths would be great.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: It would be good to have a designated cycle route that encompasses the many nature trails and walks there are in Partington so that families with small children can ride together safely. It would encourage more people to get active and explore the local area rather than jumping in the car to visit other places.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Hitting tree roots here on my bike gave me whiplash!

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
A larger pavement to support the burgeoning cafe culture here would be an excellent way to benefit the businesses we have relied on through the pandemic but also to facilitate safer outdoor socialising once restrictions are lifted a bit more. 
Cars could be routed down Broad rd and Woodlands back onto Northenden road.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Tow path surface - part surface over some of the cobbled area to support cycling.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Surface of the route for cycling

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Footway regularly blocked with parked cars

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Bollards to block vehicles mounting the footway

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The section of footway between the junction and the parade is regularly blocked with parked cars, meaning 2m distance can't be maintained. Bollards should be added to stop vehicles mounting the footway.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Footway regularly blocked with parked cars

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Bollards to block vehicles mounting the footway

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The section of footway outside the shops is regularly blocked with parked cars, meaning 2m distance can't be maintained. Bollards should be added to stop vehicles mounting the footway.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Small missing link to trans pennine trail

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
By laying temporary track down from Turn Moss car park to Hawthorne Road it completes a small but vital missing link to enable cyclist and walker to enjoy the TPT.

Use if temp track was laid similar to what is uses at festivals and construction sites would create a path for 1000s of people to use and provide access for disabled people and wheel chair users.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: I often see people leaving the pub and vaulting the central barrier to cross the road. That's not safe and if people want to go that way, why not just let them and slow the traffic down.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a key walking route to a GP surgery, clinic and Lime Tree school. This winter the footpath was under water for 3 months thus cutting off the route.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: I love the lane and use it whenever I can. It would be nice if better management of the green space could increase its potential to support nature. It would be nice if the community garden at the Cranston drive end could be given some funding and support to put in more variety of plants.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
Stopping to pay 12p and hand it to a person who is not the safe distance away.

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Get rid of the toll booth permanently.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The booth is tiny and 2 people working can't safe distance from each other or the public.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Great Stone Road approaching Talbot Road from the Quadrant gradually becomes wider before the junction, encouraging drivers to act as if there are 2 lanes. Aside from risk of traffic accidents, a lack of safe crossing for pedestrians between Gorse Ave and cricket ground means it's a gauntlet for cyclists and those on foot. Suggest dedicated cycle lane and additional lights for safe crossing

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Prevent rat running, to reduce speeds and make roads safer

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
It's currently possible to drive through the whole of the Gorse Hill estate from Thomas Street to Partridge Street, along Gorse Street, Burleigh Road, Avondale Road and Railway Road. This encourages rat running and speeding along this route when the traffic is busy on the A56.

This makes the roads dangerous and stops children from playing on them. The route also passes a primary school and a nursery.

A modal filter should be added to Burleigh Road to prevent through traffic, while allowing walking and cycling.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The current speed limit on Delahays Road is 30 mph. However most road users clearly ignore this. I would wish for consideration to installing a flashing speed display to remind people of the current speed limit - like the one on Grove Lane - or indeed a speed camera - that will help finance essential services!!

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This bridge is ridiculous.  There's so much pedestrian and cyclist traffic across it on a nice day that queues develop on either side.  It can be difficult to see people waiting too.  The bridge is so narrow that some people who have poor balance are forced to touch the structure, which potentially increases the chances of transmitting Covid 19.

It should be replaced with a much wider structure that can accommodate people walking and cycling, and also those riding horses.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: New cycle route from Urmston to Ashton-upon-Mersey

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a fantastic route now that the muddy surface has been upgraded and the barriers removed, but it's beginning to show potholes and ruts on the gravel sections, particularly by the golf course where there are dozens of deep potholes.  So please upgrade it to a smooth surface, like the Roe Green Loopline in Salford.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Improve access to the path next to Kellogg's at the end of Moss Road

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Access to the path next to Kellogg's at the end of Moss Road is currently quite difficult, due to a tight turn and overgrown vegetation. With it being a blind bend, it makes the corner accident prone and 2m distance can't be maintained.

The end of Moss Road with the blocks on the road is quite unwelcoming also, which will put people off using this route, which is a key walking and cycling route to Trafford Park from Stretford. This should be tidied up.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a fantastic facility but it's very poorly signed.  Those unfamiliar with the area, or new to walking and cycling, might now know it exists.  Please consider some signage on Lostock and Barton Roads directing people to this tunnel.  This could even be in the form of a small sign at the roundabout, saying "cyclists, do you know there's an underpass just over there>>>"

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is an absolutely superb facility enabling cyclists to safely continue from Talbot Road to Stretford Road.  My only minor gripe is that some motorists run the red light, so you have to be alert to this.  Is there some way the red light could be better enforced?

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Closing Dorset At entrance at Chester Road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Restricting car access to Dorset St at Chester Road will improve safety for pedestrians accessing Stretford Public Hall and also those living on Dorset St itself, where this is used as a cut through during Rush Hour

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: People using disabled space to park.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: People are always parking illegal in disabled space daily and nothing is done about it.  Not everyone can walk to the shop.  Time for a clamp down

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Speeding is a major issue on Chester road. With the mall redevelopping, including new bars and restaurants, this section of the road is currently inadequate. By extending the pavement, reducing the number of traffic lanes and using that space for cycling and walking, not only would it be safer but also comercially more viable. 

Also, as one of the main reasons cars speed on this section is because it is a long straight line, installing a system such as chicanes would help reduce the speed.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are no bus for shift workers.  Non for a 5am start. Only one bus per hour.  Not everyone can ride a bike and we are too far to walk anywhere.  Your just interested in getting cars off the road.  Not fair.  Especially when they have children to get home to.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The crossing near new moon is unnecessary and dangerous. Cars ignore it so pedestrians particularly children have started crossing And the car in the second lane hasn’t seen them and just drives through. We have seen several near misses.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Pedestrians crossing park rd at the junction with washway rd

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Unsafe for predestines to cross the rd here

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Crossing the road in front of the leisure centre (especially with small children) is really difficult. There is an endless stream of traffic from Northernden Road, and if there is a break, then cars come from the car parks and wharf road. Crossing needed.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Need safe area to run where dont get bullied by cyclist , cars or dogs off leads chasing you, as lone female runner feels very unsafe been out any time , please make it easier for us all to get around safely and without harassment

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The cycle lane sort of evaporates at the end of Talbot Rd to emerge again on Chester Road. This allows drivers to speed straight down Chester Road and clip cyclists as they go.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This country lane is part of the transpennine trail now that access via Dairyhouse Farm has been closed off, but the traffic related to Asda and Waitrose and workers on the industrial estate makes it too dangerous to cycle down, and sometimes even a bit precarious to walk down, particularly at certain times of day, with cars and bikes often travelling at high speed with it being a national speed limit road and really not much wider than a single track lane at parts. It would be great to see traffic on this road minimised (or at least slowed down) to enable safer access to the pedestrian part of the transpennine trail at the other end of Dairyhouse Lane.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: It is difficult to cross this round about as there are no ‘half way’ traffic islands which allow you to walk into the centre and have a better view of the traffic to make it safer to cross. There are ‘half way’ traffic islands at the round about near Waitrose/bramley farm. The speed to cars is also too fast, traffic islands might slow the traffic down.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Remove plant troughs and other temporary street furniture provided for Village in Bloom

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
I currently find it difficult to comply with social distancing while negotiating the cluttered pavements, which makes me reluctant to shop in the Village. 
Parked cars and two-way traffic have always made crossing the road hazardous.
I feel this would be a good opportunity to consider making the Village either a pedestrian zone, except for resident access, or at least making traffic flow one-way with limited parking on one side of the road, for deliveries and blue badge holders only.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: All along both sides of the street In this area drivers use the wide pavement to park. They should be fined. Pavements are for pedestrians, it’s extremely dangerous to drive on pavements. Street furniture like planters should be employed, or ideally a permanent, fully segregated cycle way erected.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Rat run. Parking on both sides of the street turns it into a single lane route, which encourages speeding. Cars parked on pavements limits footpath space. Close it to through traffic or put up speed humps before someone is killed.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Pedestrian lights can take 5 minutes to cross the road very small central wait area.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Very slow to cross the main road safely

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Inadequate, unsafe and confusing cycle path

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: My kids would live to cycle to school at Sale Grammar but it is too dangerous.  What cycle path is there already is badly faded. Part of the cycle path goes on the pavement and it’s confusing where it goes. A proper cycle path would also help reduce traffic going towards the school from Sale and the amount of kids that have to catch the bus from West Sale to school

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Hundreds of school children cross at this section daily and cars go so fast down this road. A proper crossing (lights/zebra) is needed here.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
I would like to see a 10mph speed limit in the neighbourhood bounded by Ashton Ln,- Moss Ln,- Harboro Rd and Carrington Lane to discourage vehicle drivers from cutting through at speed and allowing roads to be more safely used by pedestrians, children and cyclists. 
Also, preventing vehicles being parked on pavements to allow adequate space for pedestrians esp for pram, mobility scooter and wheelchair users. Currently many people are forced to use the roadway, instead of the pavements. If vehicles cannot be parked off-road, it might be beneficial to introduce a one-way flow on narrower roads, or road narrowing points around obstacles, such as large trees.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Long wide road speeding road users. More cycle walking priority and yes required with clear parking bays delineated.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This junction is very difficult for pedestrians to cross safely as traffic can come from 4 different directions and comes at speed, unseen, round the bend on Ashton Lane

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Concerned suggestion to make Hillingdon Road one way would move the rat run and described problems to Faulkner Road. This would need to be included in any one system and residents on Faulkner, Truro and Tresco consulted

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Chip shop queue takes up pavement

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There is a traffic island here where it is not possible for a bike and car to pass in safety. Yet some drivers refuse to slow down and let the bike go through.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The section of Ashton Lane (from Ashlands to Barkers Lane) is relatively narrow and has several corners which reduce the sight-lines needed by drivers to safely overtake cyclists. Consequently most drivers simply pass without the 1.5m gap and create a dangerous close pass.  (I had a bus pass me here with literally a few inches clearance). The junctions with Queens Road and Plant Close add to the hazards. Coupled to this, the pavement is narrow and has a huge tree across it often forcing pedestrians onto the road.  (I normally try to avoid this section altogether)

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Unsafe crossing for pedestrians at Buck Lane - Carrington Lane

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Inadequate field of view for pedestrians

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Require hedges to be cut back to property boundary and maintained

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a wide road junction on a busy main road. There is no designated crossing for pedestrians or mid-point refuge. Due to overgrown hedges and road geometry, it is difficult to see traffic coming out off Buck Lane whilst watching for fast turning traffic from Carrington Lane. A designated crossing point with a central refuge would help.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars often speed down this road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are numerous traffic islands creating 'pinch points' for each lane of traffic. Drivers speed to beat you to get through, often misjudging the manoeuvre and causing danger. The temptation to speed here is all too great for drivers and speeds should be reduced

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Take wall down, make it cycle/pedestrian access. It would reduce the traffic of people and bikes down the very narrow alleyway between St Hildas and St John Vianney.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Making this accessible by foot or bike would make moving between areas of Chorlton and Firewood safer as you don't have to go down the very narrow alleyway that you can not achieve social distance in and is very dark at night.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Renton Road and Gorse Avenue, plus many other roads on the estate

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are many cars parked on the pavement along the length of Renton Road and Gorse Avenue (and also many of the side streets on this estate).  This reduces the width of the pavement making it hard to maintain social distancing.  I think that people park in this way because the narrowness of the road means that if cars park on both sides then there is very limited room for other vehicles to pass.  As it is, it can be intimidating for cyclists when they encounter a car on this road - yet this is a signposted cycle route (and potentially a very useful one).  Most if not all of the houses long these roads have off road parking.  I suggest restricting parking along this road to one side of the road.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Upgrade this crossing to a Zebra or a Pelican crossing

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Pedestrians have to wait a long time to cross this busy road because the crossing is not very responsive to pressing the button.  There is very little space to wait and maintain social distancing because of various barriers and the narrow width of the pavement.  This is an important pedestrian rouge between residents living on/off Ayres Road and the green space/park opposite on the other side of Chorlton Road

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: As social distancing measures are relaxed and people start travelling to work, any work to create more walking space should be made permanent to improve the flow of passengers leaving the Metrolink station.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Safety of crossing road on foot or on bike, needs a crossing point

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Petition already submitted to the council for a crossing on a Barrington Road, a crossing would make the toad much safer for pedestrians and cyclists

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This junction is extremely unsafe on a bike heading north from Altrincham, especially if you are then turning right down Hazel Rd into the residential areas.  Cars from behind frequently ignore turning signals and overtake, while cars in the other direction frequently cross the white lines to try to form two queues going south.  Needs much better junction design, or maybe make a cycling contraflow on Grosvenor Road.

value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: A route to avoid a busy road bridge is compromised by barriers  . Remove the barriers and leave only a post or bollard to prevent motor car access. The barriers have recently been put there when a cycle route was opened up but why so complicated and the barriers have sharp rather than rounded corners.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Potential for a continuous route here, enabling cycling on quiet roads between Carrington and Woodsend. Two footways required, with a central cycleway. There is enough space for this.

value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: A route to avoid a busy road bridge is compromised by barriers . Remove Barriers.

value: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Visibility is poor on Glebelands rd with limited passing spaces there should be a 20mph speed limit. 
There road is also used by a lot of HGV's which are dangerous on this narrow road. there should be a weight limit to HGV's.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This junction is incredibly dangerous for people on bikes and on foot.
There is only a pedestrian crossing on one side (from Majestic wine to the other side of the A56) I have regularly watched people struggle to cross at the end of Glebelands road and there is no pedestrian route to Crossford Bridge playing fields.

With regards to cycling, There is no safe way to turn right into Glebelands rd when coming along the A56 from Stretford.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Persistent speeding of traffic down this road.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Manor Road is a ratrun used by motorists to avoid the Barton Road junction.  That's why it has speed bumps along it, while Lyndhurst Road does not (because the latter is blocked off).  Through-traffic needs to be banned up this road.  That would also make 7-ways roundabout safer.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a really handy traffic filter but there are no double yellows on the south side, so it's regularly blocked by parked vehicles.  Please ban parking against this filter so we can use it.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: There is no easy access to my workplace from this quiet road

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Ashley Road is chaotic, rammed with motorists making unnecessary journeys.  It's regularly blocked by people trying to fit huge 4x4's into little parking spaces.  People park on the wrong side of the street and therefore can't see properly when pulling back out.  The pavements are littered with A-frame signs and other obstacles.

It's a horrid road to walk and cycle on.  It doesn't really go anywhere either - most motoring here is people driving to the local shops.  Few people actually head south into Cheshire - the main road for that is Hale Road.  Ashley Road should be closed to through-traffic, the parking spaces should be replaced with cycle lanes, and the local residents should consider walking and cycling, rather than driving in huge Range Rovers.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars parked on the pavement mean that people exiting this junction onto Stretford road cannot adequately see oncomming traffic. They pull out Infront of cars and bikes regularly,

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
There are double white lines to the centre of this road.  That makes parking here illegal.  But motorists regularly park on the west side of the road, often on the pavement too, and nothing is done about it.

It's bad enough that they're on the pavement, but given that parking opposite a solid white line is completely illegal, action needs to be taken here.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
West bound.
This has been here for years but everyday there are cars parked in it.
The surface is degraded in parts.
The crossings at side roads need cycle priority and fix the lowered kerbs at these junctions.
The west exit onto the road needs rethinking as it needs a physical protection from cars coming from behind.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Cars parked in the cycle way

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Dalebrook us mostly used by residents and visitors to newyln and Dalebrook  but on occasions I ha e seen cars speeding down Dalebrook  onto the estate at bottom ashbourne and buxton some people use this road as a cut through I feel

value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a highly residential area with lots of small children and the standard of driving on the road is quite shocking, drivers speeding despite the speed bumps. It’s used by drivers especially during rush hour so they can bypass Washway Road.

value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This should be a road for people to cycle along to commute from Carrington and Partington to Sale and pick up the canl path into Manchester. Needs a cycle lane urgently

fields.value: Quiet route from Altrincham to Timperley

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: An easy and cheap win here would be to signpost the quiet route from Altrincham to Timperley via Urban Road, Welman Way and across the golf course.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: state of road, big pot holes on hole road, very dangerous on a bike

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: One trafford say they look at this road monthly and mend potholes as they appear. Someone needs a good look at it as a lot of them are over well over 2inchs deep. Very dangerous for cyclist.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Dangerous junction, with the Nisa convenience store on one corner and Constables newsagent on another.  Double yellow-lines are widely ignored and never policed.  Drivers seem to think that it's ok to block the road, to park on the path and to create dangerous obstructions because they're "only popping to the shops".  Both Park Road and Heyes Lane are used as racetracks, there will be another nasty accident here soon. This junction needs enforcement, perhaps safety cameras, so that parking on Heyes Lane near the junction is impossible, and that people walking, cycling and driving can navigate safely.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Safer cycling on this junction as it feels dangerous to cross with speeding cars and a number of HGVs passing. This is particularly when cycling from Stretford towards MediaCityUK or Trafford Park to work.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Sight-lines for pedestrians. Lack of traffic control.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
This left-turn is used by a substantial amount of traffic, both cars using the retail park but also frequent use by cement mixers and other goods vehicles.

The road layout as it exists encourages high turn-in speeds by drivers coming downhill from the canal bridge.

I've had numerous near-misses here when crossing on foot, especially at times when traffic speeds have not been slowed due to congestion.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars parking on pavements so when walking past you have to go into the road. If you have a pram or in wheelchair you can't use the pavement at all.  Reduce the price of the carpark near fire station so people who insist on driving to work in Sale can park there all day, it is never full and not used by shoppers.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Prevent cars parking on cycle track

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Turnbull Road is a dangerous racetrack used by cars zooming through the estate and avoiding congestion on the A56.  Cars park on the pavement here, reducing visibility.  Although the footpath along most of this road is marked as being a shared space, for use by both pedestrians and cyclists, there is a ramp for guiding cycles off the path and on to the road for navigating the roundabout - Cars always park here, which creates obstructions and makes walking, cycling *and* driving dangerous.  The whole road needs a 20mph limit applying and enforcing, pavement parking needs to be prohibited and the footpaths and cycle tracks need to be kept clear.

value: Consequence of making changes on Hillingdon Rd

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Some suggestions have been made to make part of Hillingdon Road one way which could move the problem to Faulkner Road. Faulkner, Truro and Tresco  residents and roads should be included as part of the consultation as these narrower roads are less able to deal with extra traffic diverting here to avoid a Hillingdon Road one way system. Parking on these narrower roads has increased as double yellow lines have been put along roads closer to the tram

fields.value:
Where the road narrows at the top of the hill pedestians can be forced into the road in order to maintain social distancing. This is particularly dangerous due to the limited view of cars further down the hill.

Speeding is also a big problem on this road as cars accelerate down the hill. Road narrowing would encourage slower driving. Space saved could be given to widened footpaths and cycle paths, which would greatly benefit students of nearby Stretford High when they travel to school of foot/bike.

fields.value: I’d like to see drastic traffic calming measures around schools. Most of the time (school drop off and pick up) I find it a dangerous place to cross the road With young children.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The approach from the park to the cornershop is very narrow, with HGVs and cars passing far too close to pedestrians. Vehicles speed up after the last speed bump Towards the dangerous junction of glebelands and grosvenor rd. better traffic calming and 20mph limit.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Very poor road surfaces make the route dangerous For cyclists. Unless you have a mountain bike. Potholes and damaged speed bumps, with traffic queueing up behind from the A56 junction. Needs better traffic calming and resurfacing to enable more cycling.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: As this is the main route from ashton village in to sale centre, cycle lanes would be a real transformation, to help reduce traffic and dangerous driving, and to connect the two high streets. I often use this route cycling with my children, but have to cycle on the pavement along ashton lane.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: A lot of motorists, motorcycles and off road motor bikes speed incredibly quickly from the traffic lights on this stretch of road. It is already difficult to cross with parked cars and there are a lot of parents with kids and elderly people who have to try to cross. Speed bumps would calm this greatly making it safer for everyone.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Cant see cars coming around corner from the right, difficult to cross safely. Cars speed round corner

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Condition of Chestnut drive road and broken speed humps

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The condition of Chestnut drive and other connected roads is very poor. The speed humps are broken. It is very difficult and very risky for two wheelers and four wheel vehicles. The road has potholes. The pavements are in neglected state.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: It will ease the traffic on washway road during peak hours and also provide more space for cycling and walking.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are a series of drivers who use the road as a race circuit - often through the night. speeding is a common problem between the mini-roundabout at the bottom of Gorsey Lane where it meets Oldfield Road and the hump back bridge where the road crosses the canal.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: School Road near restauramts, shops and bars

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The number of people who want to access the restaurants for collections/takeaways and shops currently means social distancing is difficult and people need to walk on the road and parked cars there means people are forced further into the road. Making the street one way with a pop-up cycle lane or fully pedestrianised so traffic needs to use Broad Road heading towards Sale Moor and Wardle Road or Marsland Road heading towards the town centre/A56 would help pedestrians and cyclists move more safely and businesses to safely reopen with seating then being able to be placed on the road/pavement where possible.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Crossing between Altrincham Girls Grammar School Buildings

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The volume of children crossing between the buildings with no regard for car users  and showing little awareness of traffic is very dangerous and the space allows no room for social distancing. This should be rectified by the School taking responsibility for their children and paying for the construction on a non-obtrusive bridge between the buildings.  In addition we see the same issues with them crossing The Firs to access the building on The Devisdale.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Pavement only on one side of the road therefore 2m impossible for pedestrians. 
One way system that is being ignored by cyclists.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Speeding, safety of pedestrians and lack of crossings

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars speed along this road, which is used as a crossing for families to get to Seymour Park, local school and nursery. Speeding has become worse since lockdown, but it’s a problem generally. Recent road markings have taken parking for residents into account but made it more difficult for pedestrians to cross as you have to walk into the road to see if it’s safe to cross and then dash back when speeding cars whizz up the road. The road is wide and there are no crossing points between Seymour Grove and Upper Chorlton Road to allow people to cross safely. Some crossing points and speed reduction measures are sorely needed. Once other changes to nearby roads are put in place I can see Kings Road becoming even more of a rat run into and out of Manchester.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The exit from Longford Park past the Beacon Centre has a massive puddle whenever it rains, making cycling on the safe route through the park very unpleasant

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Vehicles constantly drive the wrong way along the one way part of Langley Road. An accident waiting to happen. Needs policing. CCTV is the solution

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: If people or the council cut back hedges and bushes to the property line, it would give more space to walk. This applies everywhere and not just on Grove Lane.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The cycling connection between Davyhulme Road and Talbot Road across the A56 is very dangerous. It requires cutting across two lanes of traffic, whilst motorists speed by. There needs to be a better, safer, formal cycling connection between the cycle lanes on Talbot Road and Stretford/Urmston.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Ever since Altrincham retail park was built Craven Road has become a joke, it is used as a rat run for the 'must have it now brigade' to get to the shops quicker and the resulting damage from speeding cars/hgv's/buses and scrap vans resulted in the road recently needing re-surfacing. There is also a problem with residents/visitors parking halfway across the pavement when there is ample room to park vehicles on the road on both sides. Stopping the on pavement parking will facilitate social distancing and make the place look a lot tidier, this can be done by enforcement and/or physical barriers like metal bollards or even better plant some trees, or maybe even close the end of Craven Road at the junction of George Richards Way so the residents can live in peace once again.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
I think previous comments should refer to wythenshawe road and nit Worthington road. 
However this is a road junction close to a motorway junction and so it expected to be somewhat busy. I don’t see that there is anything more specific than that which suggests this junction is particularly dangerous for cyclists - it’s just the sort of traffic issues that happen on busy roads . 
Looking at the slightly bigger picture however  that whole junction , (including the convergence of  broad road where the convergence is askew with the wythenshawe rd convergence) is dangerous with the current road layout and drivers not consistent in its use when turning

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The scaffolding was up here recently to paint . t was actually better. Put scaffolding back up temporarily (both sides ?) so making the bridge 2 way or wider. Totally agree with nearby comment https://safestreetstrafford.commonplace.is/comments/5ec8ef34dff7479b37669423

fields.name: wouldYouLikeToSeeTheseTemporaryChangesMadePermanent
fields.value: Would need to see the evidence

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This road is often used as a cut through which results in a high volume of traffic especially during school drop off / pick up, cars speed down the road and double park which also creates dangerous pinch points and blind spots.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Hale road and delahays Road junction

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Very busy junction with no crossing.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Unusable existing cycle path due to lack of maintenance
Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Bushes are allowed to grow over the cycle path meaning cyclists can't use it and have to be on the road or pavement

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: This is a maintenance issue which should be addressed by the council. Should be proactively managing the vegetation iantead of letting it grow up

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: junction of hale road and high elm road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Lots of school buses stop here.
It will be helpful if you can introduce some traffic calming measures here

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: HGV speeding, too close to other road users.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Very narrow road. Speeding cars and worse, HGVs. Not safe for cyclylists or other road users as visibility is poor. No effective traffic calming in place. Accidents waiting to happen.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: 20’s plenty.  Cars travel far too fast on Whitehall Road and on Alcester. But there also needs to be enforcement of speed restriction and enforcement of no parking across junction of these 2 roads.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Cars go crazy speeds down this road.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Road too fast . Three lanes people treat it like a motorway . No speed camera . School children cross t s road and many times cars go through red light or have to stop skiddingAt the last moment

value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: whatCouldWeHelpToPromoteSafePhysicalDistancingHere
value: Macdonalds needs to have another exit / entrance

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Very dangerous spot . Macdonalds needs to develop a new entrance / exit . Could be done

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Half of path has vegetation on and barrier at the end is fairly pointless due to overgrowth.  Clear vegetation on both sides of the bridge.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Provide pedestrian crossing for Gorse Hill Park

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
There's currently a huge gap between the formal crossings on the A56 in Gorse Hill. This means a long walk or risking crossing 4 lanes of traffic to access Gorse Hill Park.

A dedicated formal crossing should be installed at the park entrance to provide better access to the park.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Lazy dog walkers park on the cycle lane here rather than walk or park in the many available car parks at Flixton fields and Penny Bridge lane.  Put orca wands on the road and turn the cycle lane into a cycle path.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Prevent rat running to create space for social distancing and make cycling safer

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Chatsworth Road is currently used as a ran run between Stretford and Urmston. This makes the road unsafe to play out on, due to speed and quantity of traffic. A modal filter should be added to prevent through traffic, while allowing people walking and cycling.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Provide protected cycleways along the whole of Barton Road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Barton Road is a key route through Stretford, with high volumes of traffic. Protected cycleways should be provided along its whole length. This should include refurbishing the existing 1930s cycleway towards Lostock Circle and addressing obstruction caused by people parking in it.

fields.name: whatItIs
fields.value: Prevent through traffic on Moss Road

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value:
Moss Road currently has high volumes of traffic as it's used as a rat run to access Davyhulme Road East. This makes it difficult to cross and acts as a barrier for people walking and cycling.

Through traffic should be prevented for motor vehicles, while allowing walking and cycling.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Used as a cut through and people including parents at the local private school on the road speed down our road. It’s very dangerous

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: If ever there was a place for a speed camera, this was it.

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
value: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Totally need a proper path here

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: There are constantly cars travelling at least twice the speed limit on this road. Because it’s flat and straight people use it for speeding and racing and at all times of day. It is only a matter of time before someone gets seriously hurt.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Provide modal filter across the Taylor's Road at this junction from NE corner to SW . Any through residential motor traffic would require to leave Taylor's Road and use Burleigh Rd , or Gorse St  thus discouraging some rat runs.  Also prohibit driving and parking on pavements. This means traffic would not need to do 3 point turns .

Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Some kind of barrier so cars don't take over the whole road and make cyclists come of bike and walk.

fields.value: Narrow path to avoid people have to cross road and this is some times not possible with cars on road and with children

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: Residents only parking is already desperately needed. Influx of additional park users during lockdown has made this problem even worse.

fields.name: anyOtherComments
fields.value: The road is a cut through for vehicles trying to beat the traffic lights and often at excessive speed

fields.name: whatIsTheIssueYouAreCommentingOn
